cast.overview: Record-shattering Korean girl band BLACKPINK tell their story —  and detail the hard fought journey of the dreams and trials behind their meteoric rise.
cast.title: BLACKPINK: Light Up the Sky

also_known_as: ลลิษา มโนบาล
ปราณปรียา มโนบาล
details.biography:
Lalisa Manobal (born Pranpriya Manobal; March 27, 1997), known mononymously as LISA, is a Thai rapper, singer and dancer. She is a member of the South Korean girl group Blackpink, which debuted under YG Entertainment in 2016. She is set to make her acting debut in 2025 in the HBO television series The White Lotus.

Lisa made her solo debut with her single album Lalisa in September 2021, which made her the first female artist to sell 736,000 copies of an album in its first week in South Korea. The music video for its lead single of the same name recorded 73.6 million views in 24 hours on YouTube, setting the record for the most-viewed music video in the first 24 hours on the platform by a solo artist. Lalisa went on to become the first album by a K-pop soloist to reach 1 billion streams on Spotify.

Lisa earned several accolades throughout her career, including nine Guinness World Records, a Mnet Asian Music Award, a Gaon Chart Music Award, and the first MTV Video Music Award and MTV Europe Music Award ever won by a K-pop soloist. She has been the most-followed K-pop artist on Instagram since 2019.
details.name: LISA
